23-023CH.summary: Recommendation to receive and file the Cultural Heritage Commission minutes for June 27, 2023.A motion was made by Commissioner Hunter, seconded by Commissioner Bodek, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 4 - Amy Bodek, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Mark GrisafeDIRECTOR'S REPORT

23-026CH.summary: Recommendation to receive and file a presentation to recognize California Point of Historical Interest Nomination of Site of the 1938 National Surfing and Paddleboard Championships.Alison Spindler-Ruiz, Planning Bureau Manager, introduced Alejandro Plascencia, Project Planner, who presented the  Director's Report.A motion was made by Commissioner Bodek, seconded by Irvine, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 4 - Amy Bodek, Tasha Hunter, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineAbsent: 1 - Mark GrisafeREGULAR AGENDA1.
23-026CH.transcript:
SPEAKER_01:  And do we have our directors and report, please? 
SPEAKER_01:  Yes, good evening chair and commissioners. Glad to have you here this evening. We have our former city attorney, Mike Mayt, as a retired annuitant this evening. So thrilled to have him here. And thank you for your service this evening. I know we have a couple of folks traveling with the summer season and we're awaiting a new appointment. So we're glad to have a quorum of the commission with us this evening. We have a busy agenda. So we'll get to that shortly. But first I'm going to pass it over to our senior historic planner Alejandro Placencia to talk a little bit about a recent case that's actually gone up to the state related to historic recognition here in the city. 
SPEAKER_00:  Thank you. My name's Alejandro Placencia. I'm here in the Planning Department here in the City of Long Beach. So tonight in your packet, you have a nomination that was forwarded over to the State Historic Resources Commission. And the nomination is for a California point of historical interest, which gets approved by the California State Historic Resources Commission. What the nomination is for is for the National Surfing and Paddleboard Competition in 1938 that took place here in Long Beach. The areas in the nomination, which are in your packet, are really sort of roughly bounded by south of Ocean Boulevard between Pine Avenue and Chestnut Avenue and going south towards the lighthouse. So we're really talking about what was the former waterfront here, obviously, if we're talking about surfing and paddle boarding. But that's generally the area that we're talking about. It's previously before the waterfront was changed. It was the area that was between the former rainbow here and also the Pike and Musement Park. So that area was sort of just a little nook where the competition actually took place in a popular surfing destination here in Long Beach and paddle boarding. 
SPEAKER_00:  Currently, as this commission is well aware, there's no integrity, there's no contributing resources former in that area any longer. The waterfront's been substantially modified. There's been infill that's taken place. The area that we're roughly talking about currently is the Pike area. As we know, the Pike Outlets, the movie theater, as I mentioned, just kind of going down towards the lighthouse. Why this nomination is important, recognizes the location of LA County's first nationally-build competition, observing and powderboarding here in LA County and specifically in Long Beach. 
SPEAKER_00:  This is only an informational item tonight. The action was already taken at the state level, so there's no action that needs to take place by CHC. This is just for the commission's information here. Thank you. 
SPEAKER_01:  Thank you, Alejandro, and that concludes our Director's report. 
SPEAKER_03:  Thank you. 
SPEAKER_03:  Okay, thank you. 
SPEAKER_03:  And I think it's a great thing that they did that. 
SPEAKER_03:  We have the first item on the agenda, please. Oh, do we need to... 
SPEAKER_03:  Thank you. 
SPEAKER_02:  I'll make the motion to approve the recommendation to receive and file a presentation to recognize the California point of historical interest, nomination of a site of the 1938 National Surfing and Paddleboard Championships. 
SPEAKER_03:  Second merely seconds to end. IN Economist ESSIDENTiel as respect supported PLEASE ON PRESIDENT ESSIDENT FRONって A few words must be ALL 
SPEAKER_03:  Motion carries. 
SPEAKER_03:  Thank you.

23-025CH.summary: Recommendation to approve a Certificate of Appropriateness, and adopt the proposed findings and conditions of approval thereto, to allow for temporary removal, preservation and relocation of the Historic Dolly Varden Rooftop Sign, which is a locally designated historic landmark sign located at 335 Pacific Avenue in the Downtown Plan (PD-30) Planned Development District, as part of a separate Site Plan Review entitlement application (App. No. 2212-09 [SPR22-135]). The Site Plan Review entitlement, which is not before this body or the subject of this Page 2 of 7411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, JULY 25, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESitem, is to allow for the demolition of the existing hotel building, for the purpose of constructing a new 141-unit multi-family residential building with parking and resident amenity spaces within an 8-story (above-grade) structure and two (2) levels of below grade parking at 335 Pacific Avenue. The historic sign would be relocated to the new rooftop amenity space at 335 Pacific Avenue. (District 1) Alison Spindler-Ruiz, Planning Bureau Manager, introduced Maryanne Cronin, Project Planner, who presented the staff report.  Commissioner Bodek spoke.Maryanne Cronin, Project Planner, spoke Commissioner Bodek spoke.Dialogue ensued between Commissioner Bodek and Maryanne Cronin, Project Planner.Ryan Caldera, Project Applicant, spoke. Commissioner Bodek, spoke.Ryan Caldera, Project Applicant, spoke.Dialogue ensued between Commissioner Bodek and Ryan Caldera, Project Applicant.Chair Irvine spoke.Ryan Caldera, Project Applicant, spoke.Janelle Cronk provided public comment.Louise Ivers provided public comment.Sara McKerr provided public comment.Manuel Valenzuela provided public comment.Commissioner Bodek spoke.Maryanne Cronin, Project Planner, spoke.Page 3 of 7411 W. OCEAN BLVDCIVIC CHAMBERS, 5:00 PMTUESDAY, JULY 25, 2023CITY OF LONG BEACHCULTURAL HERITAGE COMMISSION MINUTESCommissioner Bodek spoke.Vice Chair McGuan spoke.Louise Ivers provided public comment.Chair Irvine spoke.Mike Mais, Retired Annuitant, spoke. Commissioner Bodek spoke.Christopher Koontz, Director of Development Services, spoke.Commissioner Bodek spoke.Christopher Koontz, Director of Development Services, spoke.Ryan Caldera, Project Applicant, spoke.Commissioner Bodek spoke.Alison Spindler-Ruiz, Planning Bureau Manager, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke.Vice Chair McGuan, spoke. Christopher Koontz, Director of Development Services, spoke.Chair Irvine spoke. Christopher Koontz, Director of Development Services, spoke.A motion was made by Commissioner Bodek, seconded by Vice Chair McGuan, to approve recommendation.  The motion carried by the following vote:Yes: 3 - Amy Bodek, Kevin McGuan and Kathleen IrvineNo: 1 - Tasha HunterAbsent: 1 - Mark Grisafe2.
